result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun Patrick Wurm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shaun Patrick Wurm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shaun Patrick Wurm was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2 with prejudice.
Defendant to report to Probation by Friday October 9, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson DF: Shaun Patrick Wurm appeared. Case called at 3:32. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CM287. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in  15CM287. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 2 in 15CM287. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
1 year probation with conditions
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Melissa B. and her residence and children. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Domestic violence assessment and any recommended follow through.
- Costs
  Apply bond on file.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- DE not to possess a handgun while on probation. Agent will use discretion as far as a possession of a rifle. 

De to report to probation by friday noon. Bond discharged by reporting of probation.
to State's Discovery Demand. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
Plea hearing at 10-07-2015 03:30 pm

to payor ck# 024705 sent this date. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Bond on file.

-No possession of firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Melissa B. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for SRN, RPT: Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson,  DF:  Shaun Patrick Wurm appeared. Court confirms address.  Defendant does qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Refund $250.00 bond to payor.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
